place.name: LLANGYNIN
place.gazetteerText: LLANGINNING, a parish in the district and county of Carmarthen; on the river Cynin, near the river Taf, and on the South Wales railway, 2½ miles W of St. Clears r. station, and 11 W by S of Carmarthen. Post town, St. Clears. Acres, 3,270. Real property, £2,556. Pop., 378. Houses, 79. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. David's. Va1ue, £80. Patron,G. Philips, Esq. The church is dedicated to St. Cynin. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
